tests

Class AppTests

  • java.lang.Object
    • tests.AppTests

  • class AppTests
extends java.lang.Object
    A series of JUnit tests for the MiniSoccerApp application.
    Author:
    Andrew Hocking

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.awt.Robot bot 
      private static GamePanel gamePanel 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AppTests() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) void collectionAddRemoveTest()
      Create new players using PlayerFactory, add them to the PlayerCollection, then remove players.
      (package private) void collectionRetrievalTest()
      Attempt to find elements that are and are not in the PlayerCollection.
      (package private) void failGoalsTest()
      Fail to score a goal twice, and check that the goal count does not increase, the game did not pause, and the player did not get reset to their initial position.
      private static void holdKeyAndRelease(int keyCode, long duration)
      Helper method to emulate pressing and holding a key on the keyboard by doing several repeated key presses.
      (package private) static void launchApp()
      A method extremely similar to MiniSoccerApp.main, that launches the app but retains references to the JFrame and GamePanel for testing purposes.
      (package private) void movePlayersTest()
      Attempt to move both players in every direction and check that their position is correct.
      (package private) void newGame()
      Starts a new game before each test begins.
      (package private) void newGameTest()
      Start a new game and check that the timer and both players' statistics have been reset, as well as the ball's and the players' positions.
      (package private) void pauseResumeTest()
      Pause the game, attempt to pause it again, and verify the error message appears.
      (package private) void scoreGoalTest()
      Score a goal and check that the goal count increases, the game pauses, and the ball and the players go back to their initial positions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AppTests

        AppTests()

    • Method Detail

      • launchApp

        @BeforeAll
static void launchApp()
                          throws java.awt.AWTException
        A method extremely similar to MiniSoccerApp.main, that launches the app but retains references to the JFrame and GamePanel for testing purposes.
        Throws:
        java.awt.AWTException

      • newGame

        @BeforeEach
void newGame()
                  throws java.awt.AWTException
        Starts a new game before each test begins.
        Throws:
        java.awt.AWTException

      • holdKeyAndRelease

        private static void holdKeyAndRelease(int keyCode,
                                      long duration)
        Helper method to emulate pressing and holding a key on the keyboard by doing several repeated key presses.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - - The key to press.
        duration - - How long to press the key, in milliseconds.

      • scoreGoalTest

        @Test
void scoreGoalTest()
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Score a goal and check that the goal count increases, the game pauses, and the ball and the players go back to their initial positions.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • failGoalsTest

        @Test
void failGoalsTest()
        Fail to score a goal twice, and check that the goal count does not increase, the game did not pause, and the player did not get reset to their initial position.

      • pauseResumeTest

        @Test
void pauseResumeTest()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Pause the game, attempt to pause it again, and verify the error message appears. Do the same for resuming the game. Then wait for the game to time out, try to pause and resume the game, and verify the error messages appear.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • newGameTest

        @Test
void newGameTest()
        Start a new game and check that the timer and both players' statistics have been reset, as well as the ball's and the players' positions.

      • movePlayersTest

        @Test
void movePlayersTest()
        Attempt to move both players in every direction and check that their position is correct.

      • collectionAddRemoveTest

        @Test
void collectionAddRemoveTest()
        Create new players using PlayerFactory, add them to the PlayerCollection, then remove players. Verify the size of the collection remains correct at each step.

      • collectionRetrievalTest

        @Test
void collectionRetrievalTest()
        Attempt to find elements that are and are not in the PlayerCollection. Verify it is handled well.
